classSpec.desc: provides attributes that specify locational information.

attDef.desc: The where attribute specifies a location by using a URI to point to another resource.

egXML.p: This Shew hauing tendred this ſeruice to my Lord vppon the Water, is after to be conueyed a Shore, and in conuenient place employd for adorning the reſt of the Triumph. After my Lord Maiors landing, and comming paſt Paules Chaine firſt attends for his Honor in Pauls Church–yarde a beautifull Spectacle, called the Temple of Honor

remarks.p: This attribute class provides where for use in pointing to a resource containing a canonical name or information about the locational context of an event, or in the context of drama, locational context for a move on stage. The where attribute can be used for pointing out blocking cues, as in stage left, right, or center, where these locations are defined in the teiHeader or an external source. It may also be used to point to a canonical place defined in a listPlace.
